file_content.text: I'm going to go back to my lab on Coruscant. At least there I won't get anyone killed.
I owe it to my assistants to continue my work here on Voss.
Did you find out anything about my assistants?
The Voss transmissions you picked up were sent by Imperials. When your assistants went to investigate, the Imperials killed them.
They were lured into a trap.
I'm sorry. They're gone.
They're... dead? This is my fault. I should never have sent them out there alone.
You didn't kill your assistants; the Imperials did. They wanted to disrupt your work. Don't let them succeed.
The enemy's to blame. Not you.
You came here to learn about Voss. So did your assistants. They knew the risks, but they also knew how important your mission was.
Don't give up on your work.
You're right. If I abandon my research, then my assistants gave their lives in vain. I can't let that happen.
I will be more careful in the future, but my work here will continue.
You were so desperate to uncover the secrets of Voss that you sent your assistants into an obvious trap.
You were selfish.
Those Voss transmissions were fake. You sent your assistants into an Imperial ambush, and it cost them their lives!
You got them killed.
You're right. This is my fault. My desire to uncover the secrets of this world blinded me to the danger.
There's nothing I can do for my assistants now, but I won't let anyone else die. My work here is done.
Thank you for looking into this. I'll inform the next of kin.
Let me know as soon as you find out anything about my assistants.
A Jedi? Thank goodness. You're just what I need.
Excuse me. I don't mean to trouble you, but... you're a soldier, aren't you?
You're one of those freelancers, aren't you? I... I need some help. And I'm willing to pay.
My name is Doctor Forrod. I'm an archaeologist. I came here with my team to study the Voss and their culture.
Unfortunately, my assistants have gone missing. I'm afraid something terrible has happened to them. Could you look into this for me?
I get the feeling there's something you're not telling me.
Is there more to this?
I'm ashamed to admit it, but I may have let my hunger for knowledge override my responsibility for their personal safety.
I'll help, for a price.
My project is well funded. I'll see you're properly paid for your efforts.
Of course.
Your zeal is encouraging. I only hope it's not too late.
A few days ago, we picked up some unusual transmissions. They seemed to be in an ancient Voss dialect.
We were able to locate the origin of the transmissions. I sent my assistants to investigate. I haven't heard from them since.
Was there some type of warning or message?
What did the transmission say?
The dialect was too archaic for us to translate it. That's one of the reasons I was so interested in learning more.
Leave it to me.
Please hurry. My assistants have been gone three days now. I fear the worst.
I'm busy. [Refuse quest]
Easy for you to say. Go on your way, then. Leave me alone if you're not going to help.
Voss is a remarkable world. The people here are fascinating.
